Class CustomSoftAssertion

java.lang.Object
org.assertj.core.api.DefaultAssertionErrorCollector

org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertions
io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.assertion.CustomSoftAssertion
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.assertj.core.api.AfterAssertionErrorCollected, org.assertj.core.api.AssertionErrorCollector, org.assertj.core.api.InstanceOfAssertFactories, org.assertj.core.api.Java6StandardSoftAssertionsProvider, org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertionsProvider, org.assertj.core.api.StandardSoftAssertionsProvider
public class CustomSoftAssertion extends org.assertj.core.api.SoftAssertions
Custom extension of SoftAssertions with enhanced post-error handling capabilities.

This class provides additional functionality for managing assertion errors by allowing custom error handlers and associated objects to be registered and processed automatically.

Registered error handlers can define specific logic for handling assertion failures, including conditional checks based on stack traces.

Author:

      Returns:

    • collectAssertionError

      public void collectAssertionError(AssertionError error)
      Collects an assertion error and processes it using registered custom handlers.

      If an assertion failure occurs, the registered error handlers are invoked for any applicable objects, based on the stack trace and configured predicates.

      Specified by:
      collectAssertionError in interface org.assertj.core.api.AssertionErrorCollector
      Overrides:
      collectAssertionError in class org.assertj.core.api.DefaultAssertionErrorCollector
      Parameters:
      error - The assertion error that occurred.

    • registerCustomAssertion

      public static <T> void registerCustomAssertion(Class<T> clazz, BiConsumer<AssertionError,T> errorHandler, Predicate<StackTraceElement[]> errorChecker)
      Registers a custom error handler for a specific type.

      The provided handler is executed when an assertion failure occurs, and can include an optional predicate to determine applicability based on the stack trace.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type associated with the error handler.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class type associated with the error handler.
      errorHandler - A function that handles assertion errors for the specified type.
      errorChecker - A predicate to determine whether the handler should be applied based on stack trace analysis.
